intro: Acnida tuberculata, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub, reaching heights of up to 30 cm, with hairy stems and clustered leaves. Its flowers, which come in shades of purple, pink, and white, are adapted for pollination by specific insects. Acnida tuberculata is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
